markdown: <::Chart 7 Carbon Intensity of World Primary Energy Supply This line graph shows the carbon intensity of world primary energy supply from 1850 to 1990. Y-axis: ton of C per toe, ranging from 0.5 to 1.2. X-axis: Years, from 1850 to 1990, with intervals of 20 years. The line starts at approximately 1.09 ton of C per toe in 1850 and steadily decreases to about 0.7 ton of C per toe in 1990. Legend for Carbon Intensity of: wood = 1.25 coal = 1.08 oil = 0.84 gas = 0.64 : chart::> source: Global Energy Perspectives to 2050, WEC and IIASA, 1995 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/xhfl0228
